alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Chambers; Coastal Harris; Fort Bend; Inland Harris; Montgomery; Northern Liberty; Southern Liberty (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Galveston, northeastern Fort Bend, southeastern Montgomery, Chambers, southern Liberty and northeastern Harris Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Humble to Liberty to near Hamshire. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pasadena, Baytown, Deer Park, South Houston, Bellaire, Humble, West University Place, Galena Park, Jacinto City, southern Liberty, Dayton, Hunters Creek Village, Bunker Hill Village, Piney Point Village, Beach City, Cloverleaf, Downtown Houston, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, Spring Branch North and Second Ward. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Chambers; Coastal Harris; Fort Bend; Inland Harris; Montgomery; Northern Liberty; Southern Liberty
